Marksmanship Hunter Mythic+ Guide

11.0.7 - The War Within

Last Updated:February 3, 2025|Changelog|FAQ

Welcome to the Marksmanship Hunter Mythic+ guide for the World of Warcraft patch 11.0.5! This guide covers everything you need to know to understand your character! Are you starting out and leveling up from 70? Check out the leveling guide!

Overview

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter
Marksman HunterMythic+
SINGLE-TARGET
Weak
AOE
Average
UTILITY
Weak
SURVIVABILITY
Strong
MOBILITY
Strong

Hero Talents

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter
  • Your two new Hero Talent trees are Dark Ranger and Sentinel.
  • They both provide defensive benefit in different that are important to your survivability and should be taken into account, with Dark Ranger being more useful defensively in general.
Sentinel
Dark Ranger
  • The Sentinel hero talent tree mostly provides passive benefits and does not introduce an additional button to your rotation.
  • Mainly revolves around Sentinel applying up to 10 stacks to your target through different means within the hero talent tree which have a chance to activate, removing the stacks and dealing damage to the target.
  • The talent Symphonic Arsenal gives this talent tree significant damage increase in stacked multi-target situations with each Multi-Shot you use.
  • The capstone talent, Lunar Storm, makes it important for you to time a Rapid Fire whenever Lunar Storm is off cooldown to proc this ability on your target and increasing your damage you do to it and enemies around it.
  • Sentinel grants you Don't Look Back, which is useful if a dungeon has a lot of big hits that you could use extra absorbs for to live.
  • This hero talent tree introduces Black Arrow to replace Kill Shot, changing how it interacts with your gameplay.
    • Usable on enemies below 20% health, above 80% health through The Bell Tolls, and whenever you proc Deathblow.
    • Interacts with Trick Shots through Bleak Powder, giving it more AoE potential.
    • Many talents in the Dark Ranger tree like Shadow Surge, Banshee's Mark and Phantom Pain all incentivizes you to always use your Black Arrow on different targets, spreading out the DoT effect and increasing its effectiveness.
    • Is shot out automatically during your Trueshot window through the talent Withering Fire.
  • Bleak Arrows increases the value of your auto shots, giving you a chance to proc Deathblow.
  • Dark Ranger applies Survival of the Fittest to you when you use Exhilaration through the talent Smoke Screen, making it an on demand damage reduction cooldown.
  • Using Survival of the Fittest with this talent chosen also heals you for 50% of what a normal Exhilaration would.
    • Shares choice node with Embrace the Shadows. About 30% of your damage is shadow damage as a Dark Ranger so this provides a decent chunk of healing to yourself.

Talents

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter
Sentinel Mythic+ Talents

When to use this Spec

Use this spec on all key levels.

Gameplay Altering Talents

Discover all talents that significantly alter your gameplay within the Spec and Class Talent trees. This section gives a concise overview of these talents and their applications but for a more detailed look check out the Rotation and Deep Dive sections below.

Spec Tree

  • Rapid Fire + Aimed Shot
    • Your core damage dealing abilities as a Marksmanship Hunter. They are buffed by a lot of other talents you pick throughout your Talent Tree.
  • Multi-Shot + Trick Shots + Volley
    • Enables your entire AoE damage dealing kit. This combo is used in all 3+ target scenarios.
  • Careful Aim + Bullseye
    • Focuses a lot of your damage dealing potential on targets above 70% health and below 20% health.
  • Lone Wolf
    • Incentivizes you to play without a Pet active.
  • Steady Focus
    • Takes an otherwise very low priority ability, Steady Shot, and gives it a lot more purpose in your rotation.
  • Deathblow
    • Enables Kill Shot/Black Arrow usage in your rotation over the entire duration of a fight, as opposed to its usual use on targets below 20% health.
  • Wailing Arrow
    • Transforms Aimed Shot after gaining 20 stacks of Wind Arrows through Legacy of the Windrunners, giving it additional effects.
  • Trueshot
    • You main offensive cooldown, enhanced by multiple talents after it to make it a very important part of your kit.

Class Tree

  • Padded Armor
    • Grants Survival of the Fittest two charges this and Lone Survivor make up for a majority of your Defensive capabilities.
  • Natural Mending
    • Heavily reduces the cooldown of your Exhilaration ability, allowing you to heal yourself on demand quite often.
  • Emergency Salve
    • Grants Feign Death and Aspect of the Turtle the capability to dispel you on fights that apply Poison or Disease debuffs to you. Occasionally extremely useful to help yourself and your group.

Hero Talents

  • Sentinel Watch
    • Generally more value for the Cooldown Reduction it provides compared to increased burst window damage with Eyes Closed.
  • Overwatch
    • Overall more value in keys, although Crescent Steel can be good for bosses/minibosses.
  • Sideline
    • Always picked since Catch Out can cause issues with its random roots.

Rotation

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter

Tier Set

  • 2-Set: Arcane Shot and Multi-Shot damage increased by 20%.
  • 4-Set: Consuming Precise Shot increases the damage of your next Aimed Shot by 20%.

Single-Target

Sentinel

Opener

  • Your goal in the opener is simply to use as many Rapid Fires and Aimed Shots as possible, while filling in with Arcane Shot if both are on cooldown.
  • Always apply Hunter's Mark on the boss before combat.
  • Always be on the lookout for cooldown resets on Rapid Fires and Aimed Shots during your cooldowns to quickly change your priority for increased damage.
  • If you're using Treacherous Transmitter it has a "puzzle" you need to solve to gain the effect, use it 10~ seconds before you use your Trueshot and identify and delay solving the puzzle until then.
    This puts the trinket on cooldown earlier and allows for differently timed uses later on to line up with Trueshot again.
    • If you use the recommended trinket Skardyn's Grace or any other normal on use trinket, use them with your Trueshot.
  • Use Tempered Potion and racials like Blood Fury or Berserking right as you use your Trueshot.

Priority List

This is a general priority you aim to maintain throughout the fight.

  1. If Trueshot is NOT active and Steady Focus is not up, proc it by using Steady Shot.
  2. Use Explosive Shot on cooldown.
  3. Use Salvo on cooldown.
  4. Place Volley on your targets to activate Trick Shots.
  5. Cast Rapid Fire on cooldown.
  6. Cast Aimed Shot if you're at or close to having 2 charges.
  7. Use Kill Shot if your target is under 20% health.
  8. Use Arcane Shot.
  9. Cast the rest of your Aimed Shot.
  10. Cast Steady Shot if you're too low on Focus and everything above is on cooldown.

AoE

Sentinel

Opener

  • Your goal in the AoE opener is to use as many Rapid Fires and Aimed Shots with Trick Shots active as possible.
  • Always apply Hunter's Mark on the highest health mob before combat.
  • At the start of the opener you have Volley activating Trick Shots for you, but once it runs out you need to start using Multi-Shot in between each Rapid Fires and Aimed Shots you cast to make sure they cleave their damage.
  • If you're using Treacherous Transmitter it has a "puzzle" you need to solve to gain the effect, use it 10~ seconds before you use your Trueshot and identify and delay solving the puzzle until then.
    This puts the trinket on cooldown earlier and allows for differently timed uses later on to line up with Trueshot again.
    • If you use the recommended trinket Skardyn's Grace or any other normal on use trinket, use them with your Trueshot.
  • Use Tempered Potion and racials like Blood Fury or Berserking right as you use your Trueshot.

Priority List

  1. If Trueshot is NOT active and Steady Focus is not up, proc it by using Steady Shot.
  2. Use Explosive Shot on cooldown.
  3. Use Salvo on cooldown.
  4. Place Volley on your targets to activate Trick Shots.
  5. Use Multi-Shot to activate Trick Shots if it is NOT currently active.
  6. Cast Rapid Fire on cooldown.
  7. Cast Aimed Shot on cooldown.
  8. Use Kill Shot if your target is under 20% health.
  9. Use Multi-Shot if nothing else is available.
  10. Cast Steady Shot if you're too low on Focus and everything above is on cooldown.

Deep Dive

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter

The Importance of Trick Shots on AoE

  • It is crucial for you to ALWAYS have the Trick Shots buff active before you use Rapid Fire or Aimed Shot in AoE scenarios no matter what.
  • Remember that using either of them always consumes your current Trick Shots buff, except when you have Volley running which constantly applies Trick Shots while active.
  • Not doing this in all AoE cases results in a significant loss of overall damage.

Maximizing your Trueshot uses

  • Trueshot has a baseline cooldown of 2 minutes, but with the talent Calling the Shots you reduce it to about 1:20-1:30~ seconds (even lower with Sentinel Watch) depending on how much Focus you spend, your uptime and your Haste.
    • Always try to use it again as soon as possible after it comes up, since you lose out on cooldown reduction for your next Trueshot if you don't, decreasing the number of uses you get over the duration of the dungeon.
    • However, you don't want to use your Trueshot in a way that leaves it active while you're in between pulls and not doing damage to anything. If a pull is close to dying when Trueshot comes off cooldown you should still hold it for the next pull instead.

Potentially good Talent Swaps you can make

There are a few talents in the default build that are situationally not very useful that you need to keep in mind.

  • Swapping away from talents like Emergency Salve if there is no Poison or Disease dispel in the dungeon or Camouflage if you don't find stealth useful for the current dungeon.
    • Good replacements if you decide to do this are Kodo Tranquilizer or Devilsaur Tranquilizer if you need more Magic or Enrage dispels.
    • Bursting Shot if you find yourself in need of more stops or another knockback.
    • Moment of Opportunity to get a burst of movement speed increase when a Trap that you placed is triggered.
    • Ghillie Suit can be useful on certain trash, giving you an extra defensive cooldown by using Feign Death + Camouflage in quick succession.
    • Binding Shackles if you don't find any use for either of the aforementioned talents.
    • You can always swap from Implosive Trap to High Explosive Trap if you ever need to push the mobs away rather than keeping them in place.

Understanding Mechanics

Rotational min-maxing is just one aspect of mastering a specialization, but there are numerous other key mechanics that influence your performance. Use the following guides to improve them.

  • Pandemic
  • Spell Queue Window
  • Stat Diminishing Returns

Dungeons

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter

Scroll for more Dungeons

Ara-Kara, City of Echoes
City of Threads
The Stonevault
The Dawnbreaker
Mists of Tirna Scithe
The Necrotic Wake
Siege of Boralus
Grim Batol

Boss Tips

Avanoxx

  • Use defensives on Alerting Shrill.
  • Avoid kiting Starved Crawlers into the boss else the boss receives Insatiable.
    • Use Tar Trap and Binding Shot to keep them slowed and more stacked.
    • AoE them down as soon as possible, ignoring the boss while they're up.
  • Try to move together as a team to bait Gossamer Onslaught webs on the ground in the same place, leaving you more space to control the adds.

Anub'zekt

  • Watch where your tank is facing the boss to avoid Impale, especially during Eye of the Swarm.
  • Kill Bloodstained Webmages fast and interrupt Silken Restraints.
  • Use a defensive on Infestation and avoid all Ceaseless Swarm in the room.

Ki'katal the Harvester

  • Play spread from the group on this boss, and whenever Cultivated Poisons is cast you can Feign Death to dispel yourself.
  • Help with hitting any Bloodworkers if necessary to spawn Grasping Blood.
  • When you're affected by Grasping Blood you can disengage to break free from the root after Cosmic Singularity finished its cast.
    • You can also use any of your CCs on the adds on other players to break them free from their roots.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Resonant Barrage from Trilling Attendant.
    • Horrifying Shrill from Ixin.
    • Revolting Volley from Bloodstained Webmage.
    • Venom Volley from Blood Overseer.
  • Pay extra attention to these casts:
    • Alarm Shrill from Sentry Stagshell
      • A really long cast that needs to get disrupted.
    • Massive Slam from Nerubian Hauler and Hulking Bloodguard
      • A short stun that ramps in damage done per cast.
  • Use a defensive for Call of the Brood while fighting Nakt.

Pre Dungeon Start

  • Use Tempered Potion just before the key is activated to increase your damage on the first pull.

Boss Tips

Orator Krix'vizk

  • Chains of Oppression keeps you from playing in ranged on this boss.
  • When you have Shadows of Doubt on you, try to stay on the edge of the circle to make it easier for everyone to dodge the orbs.
  • Use your defensives during Vociferous Indoctrination and be ready to move out of the damage zone that spawns under the boss.
  • Dodge Terrorize whenever it is cast.

Fangs of the Queen

  • Watch out for Knife Throw. Use a defensive if you're targeted by this ability.
  • Spread from other teammates whenever Vx casts Ice Sickles, and Disengage after the damage debuff is applied to you to remove it.
  • Whenever Vx uses Rime Dagger on the tank, walk in to the circle around your tank to help remove stacks of the debuff.
  • Multiple Echoing Shade spawn throughout the fight that mimic Nx's Shade Slash frontal and Duskbringer circle, so keep an eye out for where they're spawned.

The Coaglamation

  • Use a defensive for each Dark Pulse. This happens at 100 boss energy.
  • Whenever the boss casts Viscous Darkness, position yourself so you don't get knocked into any pools on the ground and soak any orbs that are moving towards the boss.

Izo, the Grand Splicer

  • At the start of the fight Izo spawns orbs. Throughout the fight these orbs launch at a player in the group, make sure you dodge them and don't stand in the line they're travelling.
  • Mainly use your defensives for Splice since it's the highest damage event during this fight and only use leftover defensives for the Tremor Slam.
  • Kill off the Ravenous Scarabs as they spawn and use Binding Shot and Tar Trap to help control them.
  • For the Umbral Weave you use Disengage to free yourself from the root. After that, help kill any other webs remaining to free other players.
  • Avoid the circle around the tank when the boss casts Process of Elimination.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Web Bolt from Sureki Silkbinder.
    • Grimweave Blast from Covert Webmancer.
    • Mending Web from Covert Webmancer.
    • Twist Thoughts from Herald of Anurek.
    • Void Wave from Sureki Unnaturaler.
  • While fighting Xeph'itik, use a defensive if targeted by Perfume Toss.
  • Use a defensive when affected by Void Rush while fighting Eye of the Queen.
  • If the Royal Venomshell applies Venomous Spray to you, use Feign Death to dispel it with Emergency Salve.
  • When fighting the Elder Shadeweaver make sure you damage her absorb shield quickly to allow interrupting again.
    • When she casts Umbral Weave, use Disengage to break free and kill any remaining webs to help other players.
  • When the Hulking Warshell casts Tremor Slam, sse a defensive right before this cast finishes.
    • Kill off the Ravenous Scarabs quickly when they spawn. You can place a Binding Shot and Tar Trap to control them better.

Boss Tips

E.D.N.A.

  • Always stack up before Volatile Spikes to spawn them close together to ensure you can break them all with one Refracting Beam.
    • Use a defensive whenever you break the Volatile Spikes.
  • Make sure you don't overlap your Refracting Beam with someone elses.
  • Also keep a defensive for each Earth Shatterer.

Skarmorak

  • Always focus down one Crystal Shard at a time when they are up, and wait for Crystalline Eruption to run out before you kill the next one.
  • Use your defensive before Unstable Crash happens or while you have multiple stacks of Unstable Energy from picking up the orbs.

Master Machinists Brokk and Dorlita

  • Make sure you always keep your interrupt for Molten Metal whenever Speaker Brokk casts it while being far away from the group because of Scrap Song.
  • Stay clear of the middle to avoid Scrap Cube from hitting you.
  • Quickly identify which Exhaust Vent is safe whenever it is cast and stay there until it ends.
  • Always keep an eye out for when Speaker Dorlita casts Lava Cannon to dodge it.
  • Use your defensive during Exhaust Vents and Blazing Crescendo.
  • Make sure you kill both bosses at the same time to avoid Silenced Speaker from being up for too long.

Void Speaker Eirich

  • Whenever you get Void Corruption, quickly move to a portal to remove the debuff before it starts dealing too much damage.
  • Place Entropic Reckoning well so it doesn't disrupt your or anyone else's gameplay and quickly move out of the Entropy pool afterwards.
  • Use a defensive on each Entropic Reckoning.

Trash Tips

  • Focus down Earth Burst Totem from Cursedforge Stoneshaper. They have a low amount of health but are not affected by AoE abilities.
  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Howling Fear from Ghastly Voidsoul.
    • Censoring Gear from Turned Speaker.
    • Piercing Wail from Void Bound Howler.
    • Restoring Metals from Forgebound Mender and Cursedforge Mender.
    • Arcing Void from Cursedheart Invader.
  • You can line of sight the Ground Pound cast by Earth Infused Golems.
  • Forge Loaders cast Lava Cannon towards a player that needs to be dodged.
  • Use a defensive whenever you fight Void Bound Despoilers when they cast the ability Void Outburst.
  • When you fight a Rock Smasher mob, use a defensive for each Smash Rock cast.

Pre Dungeon Start

  • Use Tempered Potion just before the key is activated to increase your damage on the first pull.

Boss Tips

Speaker Shadowcrown

  • Pre-position away from the boss before Collapsing Night is cast to spawn the void zone in a good place. Quickly move out of the zone that spawns by using Disengage to reduce damage.
    • Use a defensive every time this is cast on you.
  • Position in a good place for each Obsidian Beam to minimize movement while dodging the beams.
  • Interrupt Shadow Bolts whenever you can.

Anub'ikkaj

  • Position well to aim Dark Orb down an open path, dodge the orb when it shoots out and use a defensive when it is about to explode.
  • Use a defensive for Shadowy Decay.
  • Stay away from the tank to avoid Terrifying Slam.
  • When the boss casts Animate Shadows it spawns Adds, use Misdirect on your tank and AoE them down quickly.
    • Place Implosive Trap on them to stop their casts.

Rasha'nan

  • Make sure you pick up and throw any Arathi Bombs on the boss.
  • When you get Rolling Acid, look at which direction it is going and move out towards that same direction.
  • Be aware of Erosive Spray. It applies Lingering Erosion which is dangerous when combined with other damage events.
  • During Phase 2 the boss starts using Spinneret's Strands. If this is on you, move out of the group, use a defensive and quickly move out of the web that spawns when it runs out.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Night Bolt from Nightfall Shadowmage.
    • Ensnaring Shadows from Nightfall Shadowmage.
    • Tormenting Beam from Nightfall Darkcaster.
    • Umbral Barrier from Nightfall Darkcaster.
  • When fighting the miniboss Ixkreten the Unbreakable, stay away from where the tank is positioned to not get hit by Terrifying Slam.
  • The second miniboss Deathscreamer Iken'tak casts Dark Orb towards a random player. If this is aimed at you, make sure it's aimed down a long open path to not explode too close to the group, and dodge the orb when it gets shot out.
    • Always use a defensive when Dark Orb is about to explode.
  • On the third miniboss, Ascendant Vis'coxria, use a defensive whenever it casts Shadowy Decay.
  • Right before the last boss you play a miniboss called Nightfall Dark Architect. As this mob dies the boss spawns right after, so make sure you don't body pull the boss and don't have any abilities placed on the ground like traps and Volley.

Pre Dungeon Start

  • Use Tempered Potion just before the key is activated to increase your damage on the first pull.

Boss Tips

Ingra Maloch

  • Interrupt Spirit Bolt every time a non-tank player is targeted.
  • Try to line up your cooldowns with Droman Oulfarran's Droman's Wrath to increase your cooldown's damage significantly. This happens when Droman Oulfarran reaches 20% health.
  • If you have Aspect of the Turtle ready, use it when the boss casts Repulsive Visage.
  • If Ingra Maloch is at low health after a damage increase phase it is more worth it to kill him off rather than pushing for another damage phase.

Mistcaller

  • Use Freezing Trap or Binding Shot on the Illusionary Vulpins to prevent them from reaching their target.
    • If your group is not crowd-controlling the Illusionary Vulpins, kill them off quickly.
  • Use your defensives during the Guessing Game.

Tred'ova

  • When the boss casts Acid Expulsion, don't move too much since all upcoming casts remember your movement from the past ones, sending out extra projectiles to dodge.
  • Use Binding Shot and Tar Trap to control the Gormling Larvas.
  • Stay away from the tank when the boss casts Mind Link to break your tether instantly.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Spirit Bolt from Drust Harvester.
    • Harvest Essence from Drust Harvester.
    • Nourish the Forest from Mistveil Tender.
    • Bramblethorn Coat from Mistveil Shaper.
    • Stimulate Regeneration from Spinemaw Staghorn.
    • Stimulate Resistance from Spinemaw Staghorn.
  • When the Tirnenn Villager casts Overgrowth on you, use Feign Death before it goes through.
  • In the Maze area after the first boss it is usually the healer who solves the puzzle while you kill the trash, but you can help out by standing near one of the symbols for the healer - or solve it yourself if you feel confident and no one else is doing it!
  • At certain points in the Maze area you can summon a pet and send it through the walls to pull more mobs to you.
    • Communicate with your group before you do this since it is difficult to handle if they're not prepared.

Pre Dungeon Start

  • Use Tempered Potion just before the key is activated to increase your damage on the first pull.

Boss Tips

Blightbone

  • Use a defensive if you're targeted by Heaving Retch and stand away from your teammates, ideally towards already placed Fetid Gas on the ground.
    • You can also dispel the Disease effect after you get hit by using Feign Death.
  • Always use Tar Trap and Binding Shot when Carrion Worms spawn, don't let them hit you and cleave them down.

Amarth, The Harvester

  • Use a Freezing Trap on either the Reanimated Crossbowman or Reanimated Mage when the boss spawns adds.
  • If any adds are still alive during Final Harvest, use Intimidation to crowd-control them. With them crowd-controlled, the boss doesn't cast Tortured Echoes even though an add is alive.
    • Stay away from any corpses of adds that have died when the Final Harvest cast finishes.
  • Help interrupt Necrotic Bolts from the boss or Frostbolt Volley from Reanimated Mages.
  • You can help getting the Reanimated Crossbowman closer to the boss for easier cleave by knocking them with High Explosive Trap.

Surgeon Stitchflesh

  • Be in position near Surgeon Stitchflesh's platform throughout the fight to hook him down if you get Meat Hooks targeted on you.
    • When Surgeon Stitchflesh is about to use Escape, make sure you're already in position to hook him down since they often overlap in timing.
  • Make sure you dodge Embalming Ichor.
  • Use Feign Death if you get targeted by Morbid Fixation to interrupt it.
    • This ability can also be stopped by aiming Meat Hooks at the Stitchflesh's Creation.

Nalthor the Rimebinder

  • Stay away from the group at all times and use Disengage to remove Frozen Binds when it's cast on you.
  • If you have a Warlock or Evoker in your group, ask them to set up a Demonic Gateway or use Rescue on you right before you get hit by the Dark Exile projectile.
    • Do note that you still die after 50 seconds after doing this. It's a gain if the boss has low health or the targeted player could struggle in the extra phase.
    • Don't do it if you have 0 combat resurrections ready!
  • If you do get sent down by Dark Exile, make sure you have Aspect of the Cheetah ready to complete the gauntlet quickly.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Drain Fluids from Corpse Harvester and Corpse Collector.
    • Necrotic Bolt from Zolramus Sorceror & Zolarmus Necromancer.
    • Rasping Scream from Skeletal Marauder.
    • Frostbolt Volley from Reanimted Mage.
    • Goresplatter from Corpse Collector.
    • Repair Flesh from Flesh Crafter.
  • When fighting against a Zolramus Necromancer, make sure you focus single-target on that mob instead of cleaving since all the summoned skeletal mobs die either way when he does. No padding allowed!
  • When you play against the two Separation Assistants, make sure to be in position to aim the Throw Cleaver at the mob that is not casting on you.
    • If you get Morbid Fixation, use Feign Death.
  • The last trash mob in the Necropolis, Rotspew, has a damage dealing aura around him that persists even after he dies. Make sure your group doesn't kill him where you want to fight Surgeon Stitchflesh.

Pre Dungeon Start

  • Use Tempered Potion just before the key is activated to increase your damage on the first pull.

Boss Tips

Chopper Redhook

  • Try to line up your cooldowns with the boss walking over Bombs which applies Heavy Ordnance to the boss.
  • Use your movement abilities to help you kite the boss into Bombs if you're fixated.
  • Using Freezing Trap on a newly spawned mob, especially later in the fight, might allow you to ignore it completely. Otherwise always swap to the Irontide Powdershot mobs as they spawn.

Dread Captain Lockwood

  • Focus down the Ashvane Cannoneer during the add phase to quickly use Unstable Ordnance to get the boss down from the ship.
  • During Mass Bombardment, you don't need to dodge the circles instantly as they spawn since they have a few seconds until they explode. Use this to minimize space used and maximize uptime doing damage.
  • Don't stand in front of the boss to avoid Clear the Deck.
  • Use defensives for Shoot and Fiery Ricochet.
  • If your group is lacking slows, placing Tar Trap under the boss helps keep her in place. You can also Wing Clip if absolutely necessary but should be avoided at almost any cost, make someone else do it!

Hadal Darkfathom

  • If you find yourself struggling with positioning for a Tidal Surge combo you can use Aspect of the Turtle to walk through that set of waves.
  • Overall positioning is important here. Make sure to NOT stand near the middle statue except when Tidal Surge is about to come, as to not spawn any Pools from Break Water around that area.

Viq'Goth

  • Focus the Demolishing Terror add first in each phase.
  • You're a decent class for staying and taking care of shooting the Cannon in each phase so consider doing this if your healer or someone else isn't.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Brackish Bolt from Irontide Waveshaper.
    • Watertight Shell from Irontide Waveshaper.
    • Water Bolt from Bilge Rat Tempest.
    • Choking Waters from Bilge Rat Tempest.
    • Bolstering Shout from Ashvane Commander.
    • Stinky Vomit from Bilge Rat Pillager.

Pre Dungeon Start

  • If you are not doing an Invis skip at the start, use Tempered Potion just before the key is activated to increase your damage on the first pull..

Boss Tips

General Umbriss

  • Try to stand around the middle of the room to help you dodge Shadowflame Breaths and save Disengage and Aspect of the Cheetah for this.
  • Use a defensive before each Commanding Roar.
  • Spread on the sides of the room with Rock Spike. When the debuff expires you get knocked in the direction you are facing.

Forgemaster Throngus

  • Whenever the boss uses Forge Weapon he also causes Blistering Heat, use a defensive for each time this happens.
  • Bait Fiery Cleave towards a close wall to increase space.
  • Place Molten Sparks on the sides.

Drahga Shadowburner

  • Whenever the boss casts Invocation of Shadowflame, swap your focus to the Invoked Shadowflame and kill it as soon as possible and use any CC on it if necessary. These adds are not allowed to reach the fixated player.
  • Be careful of the knockback from Twilight Buffet and dodge the Tornados that spawn after.
  • Watch where the tank aims the frontal Devouring Flame.
  • Use a defensive for each Twilight Buffet hit.

Erudax, the Duke of Below

  • Use defensives during Abyssal Corruption and Void Surge.
  • Waiting with killing off any of the Mutated Hatchlings adds until just after Void Surge is cast.
  • When the boss casts Shadow Gale, get to the safe zone and spread out within it for Abyssal Corruption as to not overlap with other players.
    • If you have Aspect of the Turtle available, use it before the Abyssal Corruption cast goes through to most likely avoid it entirely.
  • Dodge Void Tendrils landing on the ground after the boss casts Void Surge.

Trash Tips

  • Important abilities to interrupt in this dungeon are:
    • Earth Bolt from Twilight Earthcaller.
    • Mass Tremor from Twilight Earthcaller.
    • Shadowflame Bolt from Twilight Beguiler.
    • Sear Mind from Twilight Beguiler.
  • You can line of sight Umbral Wind cast by the Twilight Destroyer.
  • Use a defensive when the Molten Giants cast Molten Wake.
  • Whenever a Twilight Lavabender finishes the cast Ascension, use a defensive a few seconds after to negate some of the damage from Scorching Heat.
  • If a cast of Enveloping Shadowflame goes through on you, use Exhilaration to help heal it off.
  • Near the end of the dungeon you face Faceless Corruptors that cast Corrupt. If this goes on you, use Feign Death to stop its cast if available, or a defensive if not.

Pre Dungeon Start

  • Use Tempered Potion just before the key is activated to increase your damage on the first pull.

Affixes

The Affix system got revamped going into The War Within Season 1 retiring most Affixes as well as introducing new kiss-curse ones while also changing on which key level these appear.

  • +2 Affixes -- Rotates on a weekly basis
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Ascendant
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Voidbound
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Oblivion
    • Xal'atath's Bargain: Devour
  • +4 Affixes -- Alternates between each other on a weekly basis
    • Tyrannical
    • Fortified
  • +7 Affix
    • Challenger's Peril
  • +10 Affixes -- Alternates between each other on a weekly basis, is always the opposite of the +4 Affix
    • Tyrannical
    • Fortified
  • +12 Affix
    • Xal'atath's Guile -- Replaces the +2 Affix

Below you get some useful tips for handling different Mythic+ Affixes as a Marksmanship Hunter.

  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Ascendant
    • Your strongest tools to deal with these spawns are Implosive Trap and Tranquilizing Shot with Kodo Tranquilizer talented, so make sure you swap to that talent for Ascendant weeks.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Voidbound
    • The talent Bullseye get extra value on Voidbound weeks since the spawn starts at low hp.
    • Make sure you swap to it right away, ideally with a Rapid Fire if ready, to gain a lot of Crit from this affix.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Oblivion
    • During Oblivion weeks, make sure you play closer to melee in general to intercept these orbs. Both Mastery and Leech are very helpful stats for you so prioritize this over fully minmaxing your damage when they spawn.
  • Xal'atath's Bargain: Devour
    • Your best tool to deal with Devour weeks is Emergency Salve which becomes mandatory in every dungeon. Simply use Feign Death every time this affix is activated to deal with your own debuff instantly.

Stat Priority

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter

Understand your secondary stat priority and the tertiary stats needed for optimal performance during Mythic+ dungeons as a Marksmanship Hunter. For more detailed information, visit the Stats and Attributes guide.

Higher Item level items are better in most scenarios. For an accurate representation of what item to equip you should use Simcraft! A static "Stat Priority" is just a starting point and can easily shift depending on your individual gear.

All secondary stats are affected by diminishing returns. Click here to learn more!

Tertiary

  • Avoidance - Great stat to reduce the damage intake of "Area of Effect" abilities.
  • Leech - Provides additional healing through dealing damage. Great stat especially in AoE scenarios.
  • Speed - Way less useful for you since Marksmanship Hunter already has great mobility, but it can help you deal with certain mechanics on bosses, increase your DPS slightly during heavier movement or just help you move through the dungeon quicker.

Gear

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter
Best in Slot
Farmable Alternatives

Below you are presented with a good list of farmable alternatives that are obtainable outside of WoWs weekly lockout system. While replaced in time as you progress, these offer immediate character power.

Trinkets

Below you can find active and passive alternatives to our recommended trinkets. Do note that some trinkets are better than others depending on the mythic+ dungeon.

Active Trinket alternatives

  • Skardyn's Grace
    • Strong farmable 2 minute on use, doesn't line up as well with Trueshot but is worked around because of how strong it is for Mythic+.
  • Treacherous Transmitter
    • On use trinket that lines up best with your Trueshot cooldown.
    • Comes with a drawback of first having to solve one of three "puzzles" within 15 seconds of using it to gain the effect of the trinket.
      • Catch a purple orb.
      • Jump 3 times.
      • Stand in a portal on the ground for 2~ seconds.
  • Mad Queen's Mandate
    • Strong on use that deals a heavy amount of damage to your target over 2 seconds.
    • Especially useful when you need to kill a newly spawned target quickly.
  • Concoction: Kiss of Death

Passive Trinket alternatives

  • Empowering Crystal of Anub'ikkaj
  • Dead-Eye Spyglass
  • Ovi'nax's Mercurial Egg
  • Ara-Kara Sacbrood
  • Shadow-Binding Ritual Knife

Embellishments

  • 2x Dawnthread Lining
    • Best choice overall unless since you usually stay over 80% health over the majority of a Mythic+ dungeon.
    • Craft this on Wrist and Boots, but other slots can be considered depending on your available gear.

Remaining Sparks

  • Crafted items are 636 item level and regular items are 639 on max item level therefore it's not beneficial to equip crafted items outside of your 2x embellishments unless you don't have access to other high item level gear on that slot.

Simcraft

To find the best combination of gear available to you or identify the best possible upgrades, visit our Simcraft guide to learn how to utilize Simcraft easily and effectively.

Consumables

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter
  • Phials
    • Flask of Alchemical Chaos -- maximum DPS.
    • Flask of Tempered Versatility -- less DPS but more survivability.
  • Food
    • Beledar's Bounty
    • Feast of the Divine Day
  • Combat Potion
    • Tempered Potion
  • Health Potion
    • Algari Healing Potion -- a big burst of healing
  • Weapon Oil
    • Algari Mana Oil -- default
    • Oil of Deep Toxins
  • Augment Rune
    • Crystallized Augment Rune
  • Sockets
    • Masterful Ruby
    • Culminating Blasphemite -- Unique, use one of each gem color to enhance your Culminating Blasphemite.
      • Deadly Onyx
      • Deadly Sapphire
      • Deadly Emerald

Enchantments

You buy Nerubian Gemweaver from the Great Vault Vendor to add sockets to your Helm, Wrists & Waist.

Races

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter

For min-maxing a Marksmanship Hunter in Mythic+, different racial traits can provide a tremendous benefit to your character. If this is not your top goal, picking a race that fits your style works just as well.

Alliance

  • Stoneform -- Dwarf
    • Able to dispel a lot of debuffs from you on demand, while also providing you with a 10% physical damage reduction upon use.
  • Might of the Mountain -- Dwarf
    • Passively increasing your Critical Damage and Healing done by 2%.
  • Will to Survive -- Human
    • Can break you out of certain CC, even in PvE scenarios.
  • The Human Spirit -- Human
    • You gain 2% more secondary stats from all sources.
  • Spatial Rift -- Void Elf
    • Throws out a shadowy projectile in front of you, if you press this button again after the projectile is thrown out, you teleport to its current location. Occasionally extremely helpful for movement.
  • Entropic Embrace -- Void Elf
    • Occasionally empowering you to deal 5% more damage with all your spells for 12 seconds.

Horde

  • War Stomp -- Tauren
    • Stuns 5 enemies close to you for 2 seconds.
  • Endurance -- Tauren
    • Increases your maximum health.
  • Brawn -- Tauren
    • Passively increasing your Critical Damage and Healing done by 2%.
  • Berserking -- Troll
    • Increases your Haste by 10% for 12 seconds. Useful if you want a damage racial that provides more burst damage.
  • Rocket Jump -- Goblin
    • About the same as Disengage, except it launches you forward instead of backwards. Can be very useful on certain encounters with heavy movement.
  • Time is Money -- Goblin
    • Increases your Haste by 1%.
  • Gnome and Night Elf, with the active abilities Escape Artist for Gnome to break roots and Shadowmeld for Night Elf, have proven useful in the past.
    • However, you already have access to the same capabilities as Marksmanship Hunter with Disengage breaking roots on use and Feign Death generally working on the same things as Shadowmeld does, so they are much less useful for you.

Recommendation

For you as a Marksmanship Hunter, the overall most useful races for you to play would be Dwarf for Alliance and Tauren for Horde, with the former winning out overall since Stoneform has had much more usefulness in Mythic+ compared to most other racial active abilities that don't effect your damage.

Macros

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter

Discover recommended macros for Marksmanship Hunter during Mythic+ dungeons and watch a quick video guide on creating simple macros for your character.

Macro Import Guide Video

Cursor Macros

@Cursor Macros simply uses whichever ability you combined it with directly where you have your cursor without the usual second click confirmation. Can take some getting used to if you've never used it but makes all abilities like this faster to throw out.

@Cursor Volley 

#showtooltip
/cast [@cursor] Volley

@Cursor Freezing Trap -- Freezing Trap can sometimes require very precise placement, in those cases, you might want to avoid using this macro.

#showtooltip 
/cast [@cursor] Freezing Trap

@Cursor Tar Trap

#showtooltip
/cast [@cursor] Tar Trap

@Cursor Binding Shot 

#showtooltip 
/cast [@cursor] Binding Shot

@Cursor Implosive Trap 

#showtooltip
/cast [@cursor] Implosive Trap

@Cursor High Explosive Trap -- High Explosive Trap can sometimes require very precise placement, in those cases you might want to avoid using this macro.

#showtooltip
/cast [@cursor] High Explosive Trap

@Cursor Flare

#showtooltip 
/cast [@cursor] Flare

Stop Macro Rapid Fire Macros

These macros stop your chosen ability from being used while Rapid Fire is channeling. This enables you to spam your next button while Rapid Fire is still channeling without losing out on any damage by interrupting the cast too early.

Stop Macro Aimed Shot 

#showtooltip
/stopmacro [channeling: Rapid Fire]
/cast Aimed Shot

Stop Macro Arcane Shot 

#showtooltip
/stopmacro [channeling: Rapid Fire]
/cast Arcane Shot

Stop Macro Steady Shot

#showtooltip
/stopmacro [channeling: Rapid Fire]
/cast Steady Shot

Stop Macro Kill Shot

#showtooltip
/stopmacro [channeling: Rapid Fire]
/cast Kill Shot

Stop Macro Black Arrow

#showtooltip
/stopmacro [channeling: Rapid Fire]
/cast Black Arrow

Other Recommended Macros

Misdirection Mouseover -- Casts Misdirection on your mouseover target. Secondary use where you can replace @Solwinas in the macro with the name of the target you want to Misdirect and it casts it on them without the need for any mouseover at all.

#showtooltip
/cast [@mouseover, help][@Solwinas]Misdirection; Misdirection

One Button Salvo + Volley -- Combines the two spells into one button. There are occasionally times when you do want to use one without the other but for ease of play and to save keybinds you can combine them. 

#showtooltip Volley
/cast Salvo
/cast [@cursor] Volley

Cancelaura Aspect of the Turtle Macro -- Removes Aspect of the Turtle from you when pressed. 

/cancelaura Aspect of the Turtle

Addons

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter

Below, you see a screenshot of the author's User Interface for their Marksmanship Hunter, outlining which addons are used and how they are utilized in Mythic+ dungeons to make your life easier.

Addons

  • OmniCD -- Party track addon
    • Helpful addon for Mythic+ to check the available cooldowns of your party.
  • ElvUI -- Full User Interface replacement
    • A user interface designed around user-friendliness with extra features that are not included in the standard UI.
    • Alternatively, you can also use Shadowed Unit Frames (SUF) and an action bar addon of your choice or of course stick to the default UI.
  • BigWigs + LittleWigs -- Generic Boss Mod
    • LittleWigs is a sub add-on to BigWigs, designed to alert you of dangerous abilities with messages and sounds, give you timers for bosses and more throughout all Mythic+ dungeons.
  • WeakAuras -- Jack of all trades
    • WeakAuras is a powerful and flexible framework that allows the display of highly customizable graphics on World of Warcraft's user interface to indicate buffs, debuffs, and other relevant information. This addon was created to be a lightweight replacement for Power Auras but has since introduced more functionalities while remaining efficient and easy to use.
  • Plater -- Advanced Nameplates
    • Plater is a nameplate addon with an extraordinary amount of settings, out of the box debuff tracking, threat coloring, and support for scripting similar to WeakAuras and wago.io + the WeakAuras-Companion for Mod/Script/Profile updates.
  • Details -- In-depth Damage Meter
    • Most powerful, reliable and handsome damage meter.

WeakAuras

Luxthos Hunter Pack

Buff Tracker

Tracks your most important buffs and your Focus if you prefer using your own UI.

Changes this Patch

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter

Patch 11.0.7

Marksmanship Changes

  • Trick Shots damage percentage increased to 75% (was 65%).
  • Razor Fragments AOE damage percentage increased to 35% (was 25%).
  • Dark Ranger: Black Arrow damage increased by 15%.
  • Dark Ranger: Shadow Surge damage increased by 25%.
  • Dark Ranger: Bleak Powder damage increased by 65%.

Patch 11.0.5

Hunter Changes

  • New Talent: Deathblow Kill Command/Aimed Shot has a 10% chance to grant Deathblow. Deathblow: The cooldown of Kill Shot is reset. Your next Kill Shot can be used on any target, regardless of their current health.
    • Developer's note: Each Hunter specialization has a way to generate Deathblow, but only Marksmanship referred to it as Deathblow. These changes are meant to unify the Deathblow design while still allowing each specialization to interface with it in a unique way.
  • Steady Shot now generates 10 Focus baseline for all specs.
  • Tranquilizing Shots empowered by Kodo Tranquilizer will now prioritize players.
  • Updated animations for Volley and Rapid Fire.
  • Improved Kill Shot has been removed.
  • Hero Talents
    • Dark Ranger
      • New Talent: Bleak Arrows Your auto shot now deals Shadow damage. Your auto shot has a 20%/8% chance to grant Deathblow.
      • New Talent: Phantom Pain When Kill Command/Aimed Shot damages a target affected by Black Arrow, 8% of the damage dealt is replicated to each other unit affected by Black Arrow.
      • New Talent: Banshees Mark Murder of Crows now deals Shadow damage and casting Black Arrow has a 25% chance to summon a Murder of Crows on your target.
      • New Talent: The Bell Tolls Black Arrow is now usable on enemies with greater than 80% or less than 20% health.
      • New Talent: Shadow Dagger While in combat,casting Disengage releases a fan of daggers at nearby enemies, dealing very low Shadow damage and slowing affected targets by 30%.
      • New Talent: Bleak Powder Casting Black Arrow while Beast Cleave/Trick Shots is active causes Black Arrow to explode upon hitting a target, dealing moderate damage to nearby enemies.
      • New Talent: Soul Drinker When an enemy affected by Black Arrow dies, you have a 10% chance to gain Deathblow.
      • Black Arrow has been redesigned Kill Shot is now replaced with Black Arrow. Black Arrow: You attempt to finish off a wounded target, dealing high Shadow damage and low Shadow damage over time for 10 seconds. Only usable on enemies with less than 20% health.
      • Withering Fire has been redesigned Every 3 casts of Bestial Wrath/While Trueshot is active, you surrender to darkness for 12 seconds. When you gain Deathblow, and Black Arrow automatically fires at your target and two additional Black Arrows at 50% effectiveness.
      • Shadow Surge has been redesigned Periodic damage from Black Arrow has a small chance to erupt in a burst of darkness, dealing moderate Shadow damage to all enemies near the target. Damage reduced beyond 8 targets.
      • Visual effects updated for Shadow Surge, Bleak Powder, Withering Fire, and Black Arrow.
      • The following talents have been removed:
        • Dark Empowerment
        • Darkness Calls
        • Death Shade
        • Grave Reaper
        • Overshadow
        • Shadow Erasure
        • Shadow Lash
    • Sentinel
      • Lunar Storms visual effects have been updated.

Marksmanship Changes

  • New Talent: Pin Cushion Casting Steady Shot reduces the cooldown of Aimed Shot by 2 seconds. Choice node with Improved Steady Shot.
  • New Talent: Improved Deathblow Aimed Shot now has a 15% chance and Rapid Fire now has a 25% chance to grant Deathblow. Kill Shots critical strike damage is increased by 25%.
  • Improved Steady Shot has been updated Now makes Steady Shot grant an additional 10 Focus.
  • Precise Shots renamed to Precise Shot and has been updated Now empowers your next cast of Arcane Shot, Chimera Shot, or Multi-Shot to deal 100% increased damage (was 2 casts at 70% bonus).
  • Steady Focus has been updated Casting Steady Shot increases your Haste by 8% for 15 seconds (was casting Steady Shot twice in a row).
  • Steady Focus no longer plays its visual effects when it is refreshed.
  • Trueshot now reduces the focus cost of Aimed Shot baseline.
  • Rapid Fire Barrage Rapid Fire effectiveness increased to 40% (was 30%).
  • Razor Fragments is now a rolling periodic.
  • Master Marksman now benefits from Unnatural Causes.
  • Wailing Arrow no longer consumes Trick Shots.
  • Fixed an issue that prevented Wailing Arrow from benefitting from Hydras Bite.
  • Nerub-ar Palace 4-set bonus updated Consuming Precise Shots increases the damage of your next Aimed Shot by 20% (was 10%).
  • Nerub-ar Palace 4-set bonus no longer stacks (used to stack 2 times).
  • Nerub-ar Palace 4-set bonus will no longer be inconsistently consumed by Trick Shots-empowered Aimed Shots.
  • Nerub-ar Palace 4-set bonus will now consistently benefit all damage instances of a Trick Shots-empowered Aimed Shot.
  • Nerub-ar Palace 4-set bonus will now behave properly with spell-queued Arcane Shots and Multi-Shots.
  • The position of Unerring Vision and Calling the Shots has swapped.
  • Eagletalons True Focus has been removed.
  • Developers notes: Dark Ranger is overperforming in single target and were looking to reduce it while compensating with some AOE buffs to keep the AOE performance roughly the same.
  • Dark Ranger: Black Arrow damage reduced by 10%.
  • Dark Ranger: Bleak Powder damage increased by 25%.
  • Dark Ranger: Shadow Surge damage increased by 25%.
  • Developers notes: Symphonic Arsenal lost more bite than intended from the removal of Eagletalons True Focus.
  • Sentinel: Symphonic Arsenal damage increased by 15%.

Patch 11.0.2

Hunter Changes

  • Rejuvenating Wind now heals 12% maximum health over its duration (was 20%).
  • An issue with Ghillie Suit not activating when uncovered by Flare effect has been resolved.

Marksmanship Changes

  • Wind Arrows now fire after you cast Aimed Shot, rather than during their cast.
  • Many issues with Wind Arrows failing to fire or breaking have been resolved.
  • Rapid Fire's cooldown between procs of Wind Arrows has been reduced to 0.2 seconds (was 0.7 seconds).

Patch 11.0

Hunter Changes

  • All talent trees have had many talents move locations or have had their pathing updated.
  • New Talent: Padded Armor Survival of the Fittest gains an additional charge.
  • New Talent: Kodo Tranquilizer Tranquilizing Shot removes up to 1 additional Magic effect from its target.
  • New Talent: Devilsaur Tranquilizer If Tranquilizing Shot removes only an Enrage effect, its cooldown is reduced by 5 seconds.
  • New Talent: Scout's Instincts You cannot be slowed below 80% of your normal movement speed while Aspect of the Cheetah is active.
  • New Talent: Scrappy Casting Aimed Shot reduces the cooldown of Intimidation and Binding Shot by 0.5 seconds.
  • New Talent: Kindling Flare Stealthed enemies revealed by Flare remain revealed for 3 seconds after exiting the flare.
  • New Talent: Unnatural Causes Your damage over time effects deal 10% increased damage. This effect is increased by 50% on targets below 20% health.
  • New Talent: Moment of Opportunity When a trap triggers, you gain Aspect of the Cheetah for 3 seconds. Can only occur every 1 minute.
  • New Talent: No Hard Feelings When Misdirection targets your pet, it reduces the damage they take by 50% for 5 seconds.
  • New Talent: Territorial Instincts Casting Intimidation without an active pet summons one from your stable. Intimidation's cooldown is reduced by 5 sec.
  • New Talent: Tar-Coated Bindings Binding Shot root duration is increased by 1 second.
  • New Talent: Serrated Tips You gain 5% more critical strike from critical strike sources.
  • New Talent: Ghillie Suit You take 20% reduced damage while in Camouflage. This bonus persists 3 seconds after leaving Camouflage.
  • New Talent: Specialized Arsenal Aimed Shot damage increased by 10%.
  • New Talent: Blackrock Munitions The damage of Explosive Shot is increased by 8%.
  • New Talent: Implosive Trap Hurls a fire trap to the target location that explodes when an enemy approaches, causing Fire damage and knocking all enemies up. Limit 1. Choice node with High Explosive Trap.
  • Lone Survivor now also reduces Counter Shot and Muzzle cooldown by 2 seconds.
  • Survival of the Fittest now reduces all damage you and your pet take by 30% (was 20%).
  • Disruptive Rounds now also grants 10 Focus when you interrupt an effect with Counter Shot or Muzzle.
  • Quick Load now resets the cooldown of Scatter Shot and Bursting Shot.
  • Born To Be Wild now reduces Aspect of the Cheetah, Survival of the Fittest, and Aspect of the Turtle by 30 seconds (was 7/15%).
  • Steady Shot cast time reduced to 1.65 seconds (was 1.75 seconds).
  • Explosive Shot now explodes early when applied to a target that already is affected by Explosive Shot.
  • Explosive Shot projectile and explosion visual effects have been updated.
  • Barrage, Master Marksman, and Hydra's Bite have moved to the Marksmanship talent tree.
  • Bursting Shot is now a choice node with Scatter Shot (was in Marksmanship tree).
  • The following talents are now 1 point:
    • Improved Traps
    • Pathfinding
    • Trailblazer
    • Wilderness Medicine
    • Natural Mending
    • Rejuvenating Wind
  • The following talents have been removed:
    • Sentinel Owl
    • Sentinel's Perception
    • Sentinel's Protection
    • Serpent Sting
    • Poison Injection
    • Stampede
    • Beast Master
    • Arctic Bola
    • Nature's Endurance
    • Serrated Shots
    • Steel Trap
    • Death Chakram

Marksmanship Changes

  • New Talent: Rapid Fire Barrage Your Barrage now instead shoots Rapid Fire at up to five nearby enemies at 30% effectiveness but has its cooldown increased to 60 seconds.
  • New Talent: Small Game Hunter The damage of Multi-Shot is increased by 75% and the damage of Explosive Shot is increased by 25%.
  • New Talent: Penetrating Shots Gain critical strike damage equal to 40% of your critical strike chance.
  • New Talent: Kill Zone Your spells and attacks deal 8% more damage and ignore line of sight against any target in your Volley.
  • Eagletalon's True Focus has been redesigned Trueshot lasts an additional 3 seconds. During Trueshot, Aimed Shot Focus cost is reduced by 50% and Arcane Shot and Multi-Shot casts an additional time at 30% effectiveness.
  • Hydra's Bite has been redesigned When Aimed Shot strikes an enemy affected with your Serpent Sting, it spreads Serpent Sting to up to 2 nearby enemies. Serpent Sting's damage over time is increased by 20%.
  • Killer Accuracy has been updated Kill Shot critical strike chance and critical strike damage are increased by 20%.
  • Razor Fragments has been updated Kill Shot damage increase to 75% (was 50%). Moved to Gate 3.
  • Legacy of the Windrunners has been redesigned Each time Rapid Fire deals damage, there is a 5% chance to coalesce a Wind Arrow at your target.
  • Wind Arrows damage increased by 300%. Wind Arrows are longer affected by Aimed Shot modifiers. No longer grants Focus or Aimed Shot charges after firing 24 Wind Arrows.
  • Wailing Arrow has been redesigned and is now passive Now replaces your Aimed Shot with a Wailing Arrow after generating 20 Wind Arrows.
  • Wailing Arrow only silences the primary target and it now benefits from bonuses to Aimed Shot such as Trick Shots.
  • Readiness now causes Trueshot to immediately grant you Wailing Arrow and you generate 2 additional Wind Arrows while in Trueshot. Wailing Arrow resets the cooldown of Rapid Fire and generates 2 charges of Aimed Shot.
  • Barrage, Master Marksman, and Hydra's Bite are now Marksmanship talents (was Class).
  • Lone Wolf reduced to 5% increased damage when you do not have an active pet (was 10%).
  • Rapid Fire damage increased by 2%.
  • Arcane Shot damage increased by 13%.
  • Aimed Shot damage increased by 10%.
  • Trick Shots ricochet damage reduced to 65% (was 70%).
  • Precise Shots now always grants 2 stacks and reduces the Focus cost of your next Multi-Shot or Arcane Shot by 50%.
  • Multi-Shot Focus cost increased to 30 (was 20).
  • Many 2-point talents are now 1 point.
  • Bursting Shot has moved to the Class tree.

FAQ

Patch 11.0.7 - The War Within
Marksmanship Hunter

Q: When do I use a Pet as a Marksmanship Hunter?

A: In almost all cases you won't, but you can quickly summon a Pet with Primal Rage to provide Bloodlust for your group if no one else has it.
